topic.title: HPE Helion Development Platform 2.0: Code Engine Service Architecture

abstract.shortdesc: Continuous integration and delivery based on Git version control technologies

section.p: The Helion Code Engine (CE) service provides continuous integration and delivery. Based on git version control technologies, Code Engine automates build, test and deploy cycles so that developers can quickly bring their ideas to life and get customer validation.
It is designed for small development teams in the enterprise who are interested in building cloud native apps and deploying them into Helion Developer Platform.
Helion CE is based on git version control technologies, and it automates build, test and deploy cycles so that developers can quickly bring their ideas to life and get customer validation.

More specifically, Code Engine supports applications written in:
node.js
Java
Python It automates unit tests by using the most popular testing frameworks for each of the tech stacks, and it can deploy to specified HDP environments - whether they are testing, staging or production.

In short, we expect this CICD tool to work as catalyst in our customer's journey to modern development workflows, as it automates processes that traditionally curb agile development in the enterprise.

sectiondiv.p: Helion Code Engine Control Plane and Worker nodes are striped across 3 VMs that are not guaranteed to be in different availability zones.
